description: Demolition of existing buildings and redevelopment to provide a mixed use development of 2 buildings; one 7-storey (maximum) building fronting The Avenue, comprising three units A1/A2 units at ground floor (total 364sqm), B1 office use at first floor (763sqm) and residential above comprising 20 no. flats with balconies, and one 12 storey (maximum) building at the rear of the site comprising 88 no. flats with balconies; 258sqm B1 office use at lower ground floor, associated plant, 27 car parking spaces , 72 bicycle spaces, and landscaping, to include hard landscaping over the current footway to include disabled access arrangements to proposed shops/financial and professional services units, with vehicular and pedestrian access to the site from The Avenue
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Detailed drawings in respect of the new wall to the front of the site, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing prior to commencement of development. Such details shall be implemented only in accordance with the drawings and/or samples as approved.  REASON: To ensure the design is of high quality in keeping with the surroundings, in accordance with Adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5 | Detailed drawings and/or samples of materials, as appropriate, in respect of the following, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing prior to commencement of development:(a) all external materials including facades, roofs, fenestration/doors and glazing, balconies (b) all external surfaces including podium area, and ramp and steps to The Avenue.  Such details shall be implemented only in accordance with the drawings and/or samples as approved.  REASON: To ensure the design is of high quality in keeping with the surroundings, in accordance with Adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5 | No new windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings permitted.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the appearance of the area, in accordance with the adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 4.7. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans 6001 04 (rec. 5/8/05), C208 002 and 003 (rec. 29/10/04), no development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works (to include details of soil depths and irrigation system for planting at podium level, and semi-mature trees  to the front of the site), including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with  a phasing programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with Adopted UDP policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 . | No development shall take place until a schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of 5 years from the implementation of final planting  has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.   REASON: To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with Adopted UDP policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment and fences to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed in accordance with a timetable agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and shall be permanently retained.   REASON: To protect the appearance of the site and security of the area in accordance with Adopted UDP policies, 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5. | Prior the first occupation of the building hereby permitted, the residential units identified as 2.15, 3.15, 4.13, 5.8 and 6.8 on the approved drawings, shall be designed and fitted out as wheelchair  units and shall thereafter be so retained, and units G2, 1.3, 2.3, 3.3, 4.3 and 5.3 shall be designed as disabled units and thereafter be so retained.  REASON: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities in accordance with Adopted UDP policy 4.3. | Details of access for people with disabilities, including access to the communal area, pathways and retail units, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development and the approved scheme shall be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies 4.1, 4.3 & 5.3. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans, details of refuse storage and waste management (including provision for recycling) for the residential and commercial uses, in accordance with the adopted standards shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be implemented as approved prior to first occupation of any part of the development and retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living and working conditions of occupiers of the area and to meet the Council's sustainability policies in accordance with Adopted UDP policy 2.10 | Notwithstanding of the layout of car parking spaces shown on drawing no. 6000-06, details of car parking layout shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works. The car parking spaces shall not exceed 27 in number, 10 of which shall be marked out and maintained as disabled bays and 3 of which marked out and maintained as City Car Club spaces.  Such details as approved shall be marked out on the site, prior to first occupation of the development, and these spaces shall thereafter be kept continuously available without obstruction for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose without the prior permission in writing of the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with Adopted UDP policy 9.1 | The areas shown on the tracking plan ealing.1/refuse.2  (received 15/9/05) as access, servicing and manoeuvring areas for refuse and emergency vehicles shall be kept clear at all times and used for these purposes only.  REASON: To ensure that adequate access and servicing space is available within the site in accordance with Adopted UDP policy 9.1 | Notwithstanding details shown on drawing 6001 05, details of sevicing for the retail units, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works. Submitted details shall include one designated loading bay to meet the required standard, the size of service vehicles and frequency of deliveries.  The details of loading bay as approved shall be marked out on the site, prior to first occupation of the development, and shall thereafter be kept continuously available without obstruction for loading/unloading for the retail units and shall not be used for any other purpose or operate in any way other than that approved without the prior permission in writing of the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for servicing within the site in accordance with Adopted UDP policy 9.1 | Notwithstanding any Travel Plan details submitted, a  Green Travel Plan, designed to manage the transport needs of staff, residents and vistors to the site and to minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development.  The details shall include targets to be monitored by the Local Planning Authority annually, or a timetable as otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority. The approved scheme shall be implemented at the time of first occupation of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained in operation thereafter.   REASON:  To ensure that the Council's policies on sustainability are met, to minimise car use and promote alternative modes of travel for staff and visitors to and from the site in accordance with the adopted UDP policy 9.1. | Notwithstanding any indications on drawing no. 6000-05 (received 2/8/05), prior to commencement of works, details of secure cycle parking and shower facilities shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The approved facilities shall be provided prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and shall be permanently retained.   REASON: To ensure that adequate cycle parking and associated facilities are available within the site in accordance with Adopted UDP policy 9.6. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans, details of the size, location and details of equipment for the children's playspace shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Prior to first occupation such provision shall be implemented as approved and retained permanently.  REASON: To ensure satisfactory development and the provision of play facilities in accordance with Adopted UDP policy 3.5. | No servicing or deliveries to the commercial units shall take place outside 8am to 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 1pm on Saturdays, and there shall be no servicing or deliveries at any time on Sundays or Public/Bank Holidays.  REASON:  In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with the adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 4.11. | No additional machinery, plant, openings or ducts shall be installed on any elevations of the buildings hereby permitted without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained via the submission of a planning application.  REASON: To protect the appearance of the development and living and working conditions of occupiers in the surrounding area in accordance with the adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 4.11. | Details of sound attenuation measures for aircraft noise shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced. The works as approved shall be completed for each building before first occupation of any of the residential or commercial units in that building and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To protect the internal living and working conditions of future occupiers of the development in accordance with Adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 4.11. | Details of sound attenuation measures for plant shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced. The works as approved shall be completed for each building before first occupation of any of the residential or commercial units in that building and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living and working conditions of occupiers of the site and surroundings in accordance with Adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 4.11. | Details of the proposed ventilation to habitable rooms shall be shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works.  Such details as approved shall be implemented for each building in accordance with the approval before first occupation of any of the residential units in that building and thereafter permanently retained.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the site in accordance with Adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 4.11. | Details of all external lighting to be erected shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development commencing.  The lighting as approved shall be installed prior to the first occupation, or in accordance with a phased programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority and shall be maintained in accordance with the approved standards thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and the safe operation of the adjacent railway in accordance with Adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 4.12. | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, a detailed land investigation shall be carried out, using sampling points and methods agreed with the Local Planning Authority to establish if the site is contaminated, to assess the degree and nature of the contamination present, and to determine its potential for the pollution of the water environment. A risk assessment shall be prepared and a scheme shall then be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to describe the proposed methods of removal, neutralising or sealing of the contamination, including the prevention of pollution of groundwater and surface water and for the remedial works and subsequent monitoring which shall be implemented before any other works commence.  The development shall then proceed in strict accordance with the measures approved.  REASON: To protect health and safety and to prevent pollution of the water environment, in accordance with adopted UDP policies 2.7 and 4.1. | Details of crime prevention and security measures for the buildings, car parking areas,  cycle parking areas (including access controls to the car park and entrance doors), hard and soft landscaped areas, and bin storage areas, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development. The approved details shall be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies 4.3 and 4.4 and adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 8 'Safer Ealing'. | No development shall take place until the applicant has secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological work in accordance with a written scheme for investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The archaeological works shall be carried out by a suitably qualified investigating body acceptable to the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: Important archaeological remains may exist on this site and the Local Planning Authority wishes to secure the provision of archaeological investigation and the subsequent recording of the remains prior to development, in accordance with adopted UDP policy 4.9. | Notwithstanding the submitted sustainability checklist, details of a scheme to promote sustainability in building design shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of development; the scheme shall be implemented as approved and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure that the development is sustainable in accordance with Adopted UDP policies 2.9 and 4.1. | Details of measures to provide renewable energy for the development shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development.  The approved details shall be implemented for each building prior to first occupation of the building and retained permanently.  REASON:  To ensure the proposal contributes to its energy requirements in accordance with in accordance with the adopted UDP policy 2.9. | Details of the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any work commencing on site: (a) finished floor levels of the buildings at basement and ground floor levels, together with finished ground levels, in relation to the surrounding properties; (b) the level of the podium/amenity area relative to the ground floor/ground level of neighbouring sites; (c) details of ground levels across the site.The development shall thereafter be carried out solely in accordance with the approved details.  REASON: In the interest of the amenities of adjacent properties in accordance with adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5. | The ground floor retail/commercial units in the building fronting The Avenue shall not be amalgamated without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained via the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To enable the Local Planning Authority to assess the potential impact of a larger retail or office unit on the character, amenities and retail/commercial function of the area, and to assess the highway implications of such a proposal, in accordance with adopted UDP policies 7.1 and 9.1. | No development shall take place until off-site highway works in association with the development, to include the stopping up of the footpath on The Avenue, have been implemented, details of which shall have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interest of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with adopted UDP policy 9.1. | The entire root system of trees to be retained, as shown on the approved drawings, indicated by the spread of their branches, shall be protected by stout exclusion fencing until completion of the development.  REASON:  To prevent damage to the trees in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 4.5. | The area beneath the spread of the branches of the trees to be retained as shown on the approved drawings shall not be used for the storage of building materials, plant, machinery or other items, or for vehicular access or for the burning of materials of any kind.  REASON:  To prevent damage to the trees in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with UDP policies 4.1 and 4.5.
